Note:
This version of the Pater noster without the Exposition occurs in the Lay Folk’s Mass Book (Simmons (1879)
XSimmons, Thomas Frederick. The Lay Folks’ Mass Book.
EETS o.s. 71 (1879); repr. 1968, 46-7).
_description: Pater noster, followed by Exposition — 134 couplets

BodFair14.First Lines:
Fader ours þat is in heiuenblessed bi þi name to
                    neyuen…
BodFair14.Last Lines:
…& shilde vs fra alkin illeAmen leue fader þou hit
                    fulfille

BlCottGalEIX.First Lines:
Crist him self made þis prayereWharfore it es with outen
                    pereþare es no prayer þat ordand esso medeful of þe
                    mikilnes…
BlCottGalEIX.Last Lines:
…oure blisced fader þou it fulfilland schild vs euer fro
                    alkins ill
BlCottGalEIX.Attributed Title:
Pater noster qui es in celis (in engrossed initials with decorated
                    red ‘P’, top f. 73vb)

BLCottVesAIII.First Lines:
ffader vrs þat es in heuenHalud be þi nam to
                    neuen…
BLCottVesAIII.Last Lines:
…And sceild us all fra alkin ilAmen leif fader þou it ful
                    fill

GottingenTheo107.First Lines:
fAdir vr þat es in heuenHalud be þi nam to
                    neuen…
GottingenTheo107.Last Lines:
…Bot schild vs fra alkin illAmen fadir þu it
                    fulfill
